Class Order

java.lang.Object
Order
public class Order
extends java.lang.Object
Holds the data for each daily order, including an arraylist of orderlines for each tool that has been ordered. Allows new tools to be ordered, and displays the relevant individual tool order information to the user.

Since:
2019-10-12
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ryan Lisowski (ID: 00257796)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Order​(java.time.LocalDate currentDate)
    Constructor that sets the order date to the current (simulation) date for the program, generates a random order ID, and creates a new list of orderlines for the order.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addOrderLine​(Tool toolToOrder, int orderQuantity)
    Adds a tool orderline to the current order.
    java.time.LocalDate getOrderDate()
    Gets the order date for the order.
    int getOrderID()
    Gets the 5-digit randomly-generated ID for the order.
    java.lang.String printOrderLines()
    Prints the data for the tool orderline to a string variable.
    void removeOrderLineForSameTool​(Tool tool)
    Checks the list that contains the daily orderlines to see if an orderline already exists for that tool.
    void setOrderDate​(java.time.LocalDate orderDate)
    Sets the order date for the order.
    void setOrderID​(int orderID)
    Sets the order ID for the order.
    void updateToolQuantities()
    Iterates through each orderline, updating the associated tool with the new tool quantity.

    • getOrderID

      public int getOrderID()
      Gets the 5-digit randomly-generated ID for the order.
      Returns:
      int The 5-digit randomly-generated ID for the order.

    • setOrderID

      public void setOrderID​(int orderID)
      Sets the order ID for the order.
      Parameters:

    • addOrderLine

      public void addOrderLine​(Tool toolToOrder, int orderQuantity)
      Adds a tool orderline to the current order.
      Parameters:
      toolToOrder - The tool that is to be ordered.
      orderQuantity - The quantity of the tool to be ordered.

    • printOrderLines

      public java.lang.String printOrderLines()
      Prints the data for the tool orderline to a string variable.
      Returns:
      String Holds the text for the orderline.

    • updateToolQuantities

      public void updateToolQuantities()
      Iterates through each orderline, updating the associated tool with the new tool quantity.

    • removeOrderLineForSameTool

      public void removeOrderLineForSameTool​(Tool tool)
      Checks the list that contains the daily orderlines to see if an orderline already exists for that tool. If so, the old orderline is replaced by a a new orderline for the tool.
      Parameters:
      tool - The tool that an orderline will be created for.
